text:
Yes that looks reasonable. Assuming you're arriving in Heathrow you can get the Elizabeth Line/Underground train to Euston and pay for that with your phone's NFC (tap on the barriers, same for contactless cards) or use the ticket machines to pay by cash/card.

For anyone that's not bought a ticket yet it's worth comparing time/cost with National Express (<https://warwick.ac.uk/about/visiting/directions/international/>) - that goes direct from Heathrow to Coventry Pool Meadow bus station, where the 12 X and 11 start from.

I can't say for sure that contactless payment will work for international visitors, but in theory yes, you can just tap your phone/payment card without needing an app.

Local buses are regular and fairly punctual, sometimes a few minutes late. Trains vary a lot, it's not unusual to have delays. Try to get flexible tickets if not too expensive (Anytime/Off-peak return on the train, Fully Flexible on National Express).
